main event: An observer in Corvallis, Oregon, saw an 'astro(naut)' object while putting his dog out on March 29, 1967.
interesting points: The observer noted the object was on an azimuth of 164 degrees at an elevation of 30 degrees., The object remained stationary and did not disappear while being observed., The sighting lasted for 15 minutes., The document suggests the object was likely the brightest in the southern sky at that time., The observer speculated it might have been a satellite, but the description did not match satellite observations.
witness description: The observer was putting a dog outside when he looked up to see the object.
